1{-# LANGUAGE FlexibleInstances #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Term types and related functions.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Symbol.Term
7  ( -- * Term
8    Term, term,
9
10    -- * Term name
11    TermName, TermPath,
12    ToTermName (..),
13    enslash,
14    stringTermName,
15    termNameString, termPathString,
16    termNameContent,
17    termNameSign, termNameAltSign,
18    orderingTermName,
19
20    -- * Term name tuple
21    TermName2, TermName3,
22    TermName4, TermName5, TermName6,
23
24    -- * Term index
25    TermIndex, IndexTerm,
26    termP, termN,
27    termsP, termsN, termsPN,
28  ) where
29
30import qualified Data.String                as S
31import qualified Data.Text                  as Tx
32import qualified Data.Text.Lazy             as Tz
33import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture   as O
34
35
36-- ----------------------  Term
37
38-- | Term type: pair of term name and content.
39type Term c = (TermName, c)
40
41-- | Create term.
42--
43--   >>> term "size" 10 :: Term Int
44--   (TermName "size", 10)
45--
46term :: (ToTermName n) => n -> c -> Term c
47term n c = (toTermName n, c)
48
49
50-- ----------------------  Term name
51
52-- | Name of term, e.g., @\"size\"@ for the term name @\/size@.
53data TermName =
54    TermName Ordering String
55    deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
56
57instance S.IsString TermName where
58    fromString = toTermName
59
60-- | Path of term names, e.g., term name @\/r\/x@
61--   is correspond to path @[\"r\", \"x\"]@.
62type TermPath = [TermName]
63
64-- | Convert to term name.
65class ToTermName a where
66    toTermName :: a -> TermName
67
68instance ToTermName TermName where
69    toTermName = id
70
71-- | Remove leading slash character.
72instance ToTermName String where
73    toTermName = stringTermName
74
75-- | Strict text.
76instance ToTermName Tx.Text where
77    toTermName = toTermName . Tx.unpack
78
79-- | Lazy text.
80instance ToTermName Tz.Text where
81    toTermName = toTermName . Tz.unpack
82
83-- | Integer term name.
84instance ToTermName Int where
85    toTermName = toTermName . show
86
87-- | Add necessary slash character indicating term name.
88--
89--   >>> enslash <$> ["foo", "/bar", "+/baz", "-/qux"]
90--   ["/foo", "/bar", "+/baz", "-/qux"]
91--
92enslash :: O.Map String
93enslash n@('/' : _)        = n
94enslash n@('+' : '/' : _)  = n
95enslash n@('-' : '/' : _)  = n
96enslash n                  = '/' : n
97
98-- | Decode term name from string.
99--
100--   >>> stringTermName "/a"
101--   TermName EQ "a"
102--
103--   >>> stringTermName "+/a"
104--   TermName GT "a"
105-- 
106stringTermName :: String -> TermName
107stringTermName ('/' : n)        = TermName EQ n
108stringTermName ('+' : '/' : n)  = TermName GT n
109stringTermName ('-' : '/' : n)  = TermName LT n
110stringTermName n                = TermName EQ n
111
112-- | Encode term name into string.
113--
114--   >>> termNameString $ stringTermName "/size"
115--   "/size"
116--
117termNameString :: TermName -> String
118termNameString (TermName EQ n) = enslash n
119termNameString (TermName GT n) = '+' : enslash n
120termNameString (TermName LT n) = '-' : enslash n
121
122-- | Extract internal name.
123--
124--   >>> termNameContent $ stringTermName "/size"
125--   "size"
126--
127termNameContent :: TermName -> String
128termNameContent (TermName _ n) = n
129
130-- | Encode term path into string.
131--
132--   >>> termPathString [stringTermName "r", stringTermName "x"]
133--   "/r/x"
134--
135termPathString :: TermPath -> String
136termPathString = concatMap termNameString
137
138-- | Sign of term name.
139termNameSign :: TermName -> Ordering
140termNameSign (TermName sign _) = sign
141
142-- | Alter sign of term name.
143termNameAltSign :: Ordering -> O.Map TermName
144termNameAltSign sign (TermName _ n) = TermName sign n
145
146-- | Convert to ordering pair.
147orderingTermName :: TermName -> (Ordering, TermName)
148orderingTermName n@(TermName sign _) = (sign, n)
149
150
151-- ----------------------  Term name tuple
152
153-- | Tuple of 2 term names.
154type TermName2 = (TermName, TermName)
155
156-- | Tuple of 3 term names.
157type TermName3 = (TermName, TermName, TermName)
158
159-- | Tuple of 4 term names.
160type TermName4 = (TermName, TermName, TermName, TermName)
161
162-- | Tuple of 5 term names.
163type TermName5 = (TermName, TermName, TermName, TermName, TermName)
164
165-- | Tuple of 6 term names.
166type TermName6 = (TermName, TermName, TermName, TermName, TermName, TermName)
167
168
169-- ----------------------  Term index
170
171-- | Term index.
172type TermIndex = Int
173
174-- | Term name and index.
175type IndexTerm = (TermName, TermIndex)
176
177-- | Test present term.
178--
179--   >>> termP 2
180--   True
181--
182--   >>> termP 0
183--   True
184--
185--   >>> termP (-1)
186--   False
187--
188termP :: O.Test TermIndex
189termP = (>= 0)
190
191-- | Test new term.
192termN :: O.Test TermIndex
193termN = (< 0)
194
195-- | Test all terms are present.
196termsP :: O.Test [TermIndex]
197termsP = all termP
198
199-- | Test all terms are new.
200--
201--   >>> termsN [-1, -1]
202--   True
203--
204termsN :: O.Test [TermIndex]
205termsN = all termN
206
207-- | Test present and new terms.
208--
209--   >>> termsPN [1,2] [-1]
210--   True
211--
212--   >>> termsPN [1,2] [-1,0]
213--   False
214--
215termsPN :: O.Test2 [TermIndex] [TermIndex]
216termsPN ps ns = termsP ps && termsN ns
217
